title: What should I make for Thanksgiving? - Quora

response.answer_text: First are you doing all the cooking or are you getting help. Which by the way is one of the best ways to handle it, if you are doing everything, then hang on. Turkey, for me that’s a fresh turkey, if I had a choice it would be fresh, they simply taste better and you don’t have to worry about it being thawed out. Figure 3 to 4 ounces per person (roughly). Next stuffing, I really like Pepperidge Farm stuffing mix, follow the directions, though for me I add a little more poultry seasoning. Never use water, use broth or stock. I know I’m about to tick off a bunch of nutritionist but stuff the turkey with the stuffing. You only do this once a year, I’m pretty sure you won’t die after one day. Mashed potatoes a given, try Yukon gold, in my opinion they make the best mashed. Candied yams and I don’t mean the marshmallow kind. My family recipe is simple bake your yams the night before, chill, peel and slice the thinly the next day on to a rimmed cookie sheet. Slice REAL butter into thin slices and dot the yams, usually this takes one cube per pan of yams, sprinkle generously with brown sugar. Though I’ve seen similar recipes that add chopped peanuts, I don’t. Cook at 425 for about 20 minutes. I usually do this while the turkey is resting. Then oven roasted Brussels Sprouts. (Know most people think it should be green bean casserole). Rolls, for desert try pumpkin, pecan pie, and for a different desert try brownies with ice cream. If you need any recipe for the pies, I will gladly share mine, on a different “page”. PS, cranberry and gravy.

~~~~~<DRESSING - GOOD OLD COUNTRY- THANKSGIVING >~~~~~ 24 oz herbed dry stuffing bread.......8 oz crushed Ritz or saltine crackers......12 oz bulk breakfast sausage.....16 oz ground pork.........9 large stalks celery, chopped..........2 onions - 400 g, chopped............3 cups chicken bouillon.......1 cup water or as needed (opt)........2 tsp salt.......1 tsp freshly ground black pepper.......4 1/4 Tbsp dried sage or 12 g fresh......3 Tbsp dried parsley or 12 g fresh......2 1/2 Tbsp poultry seasoning.........4 eggs, beaten......2 sticks butter....5 small loaf pans. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. PREPARE INGREDIENTS - Put everything in separate bowls: Chop celery. Weigh out onion and chop. Grind crackers. Put herbed bread in 12 qt container along with ground crackers. Beat eggs and add to bread mixture, stir. Grind parsley and sage. Put parsley and sage into small bowl, add poultry seasoning, salt and pepper, mix. Saute sausage and pork in large wok. Add browned meat to container and mix. Add butter to wok and when it melts add celery and onion with sage, poultry seasoning, salt and pepper mixture.. Sauté until transparent, 5 to 10 minutes. Pour over bread mixture and stir. Add bouillon slowly to bread mixture, stir. If needed add water. You want it a little moist for leftovers. Best to reheat just what you need after initial cooking. Pour stuffing into a greased pans. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until thermometer reads 165F.
